qas.question: What sea creatures were used in traditional handicrafts?
In what item has Tuvalu traditional design been produced?
What type of decorative items use traditional Tuvalu designs?
For what  have objects having traditional design been used?
What traditional purpose are Tuvalu designs still used?

context: The women of Tuvalu use cowrie and other <a0_0>shells<a0_0/> in traditional handicrafts. The artistic traditions of Tuvalu have traditionally been expressed in the design of <a1_0>clothing<a1_0/> and traditional handicrafts such as the decoration of <a2_0>mats and fans<a2_0/>. Crochet (kolose) is one of the art forms practiced by Tuvaluan women. The material culture of Tuvalu uses traditional design elements in artefacts used in <a3_0>everyday life<a3_0/> such as the design of canoes and fish hooks made from traditional materials. The design of women's skirts (titi), tops (teuga saka), headbands, armbands, and wristbands, which continue to be used in performances of the traditional <a4_0>dance songs<a4_0/> of Tuvalu, represents contemporary Tuvaluan art and design.
